CMSC.title: Computer Science I for Majors
CMSC.description: An introduction to computer science through problem solving and computer programming.

CMSC.title: Computer Science II for Majors
CMSC.description: This course continues the development of the ability of the student to program and problem-solve by providing an introduction to object-oriented design and programming (OOP).

CMSC.title: Discrete Structures
CMSC.description: This course introduces the fundamental tools, topics and concepts of discrete mathematics needed to study computer science.

CMSC.title: Social and Ethical Issues in Information Technology
CMSC.description: A survey course that reviews social issues and the ethical impact of information technology throughout the world.

CMSC.title: Computer Organization and Assembly Language Programming
CMSC.description: This course introduces the student to the low-level abstraction of a computer system from a programmerï¿½s point of view, with an emphasis on low-level programming.

CMSC.title: Principles of Programming Language
CMSC.description: This course examines the theory, design and implementation of programming languages and provides students with an introduction to programming languages that are likely to be new to them.

CMSC.title: Data Structures
CMSC.description: An examination of a range of advanced data structures, with an emphasis on an object-oriented approach.

CMSC.title: Software Design and Development
CMSC.description: This course introduces the basic concepts of software engineering, including software life cycle, requirements analysis and software design methods.

CMSC.title: Computer Architecture
CMSC.description: This course covers the design of complex computer systems making heavy use of the components and techniques discussed in CMSC 313, CMPE 212 and CMPE 310.

CMSC.title: Principles of Operating Systems
CMSC.description: An introduction to the fundamentals of operating systems.

CMSC.title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
CMSC.description: This course studies fundamental algorithms, strategies for designing algorithms, and mathematical tools for analyzing algorithms.

CMSC.title: Software Engineering I
CMSC.description: This course introduces the basic concepts of software engineering, including software life cycle, requirements analysis and software design methods.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Principles of Computer Security
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: This course will provide an introduction to computer security, with specific focus on the computing aspects.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Compiler Design Principles
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: A detailed study of the design and implementation of a compiler for a high-level programming language.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Computer Graphics
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: An introduction to the fundamentals of interactive computer graphics.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Software Engineering II
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: A continuation of the study of software engineering with emphasis on topics not fully covered in CMSC 345 and CMSC 447.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Automata Theory and Formal Languages
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: This course introduces the basic concepts in the theory of formal languages.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Numerical Computations
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: Topics include numerical linear algebra, interpolation, solving non-linear systems and the numerical solution of differential equations.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Symbolic Computation
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: The theme of this course is abstract algebra from an algorithmic perspective.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Database Management Systems
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: This course covers database management and the different data models used to structure the logical view of databases.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: This course provides a broad introduction to artificial intelligence, its sub-fields and their applications.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Computer Networks
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: This course introduces the fundamentals of data communication and computer networking, including circuit and packet switching network architectures and protocols local/metropolitan/wide-area networks, OSI and TCP/IP standards network programming and applications and network management.

CMSC_REQ_ELEC.title: Parallel and Distributed Processing
CMSC_REQ_ELEC.description: This course introduces the fundamentals of data communication and computer networking, including circuit and packet switching network architectures and protocols local/metropolitan/wide-area networks, OSI and TCP/IP standards network programming and applications and network management.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Advanced programming techniques in Java will be presented.
CMSC_ELEC.description: The use of networking, threaded programs and techniques for object reflection and persistence will be discussed in class and will be the motivation for homework assignments.

CMSC_ELEC.title: This course examines important issues concerning women, gender and information technology (IT).
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course examines important issues concerning women, gender and information technology (IT).

CMSC_ELEC.title: Wearable Computing
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course covers fundamental concepts, methodologies, and algorithms related to wearable computing.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Object-Oriented Programming Languages and Systems
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course covers the concepts of object-oriented programming (OOP) languages and systems, including an introduction to fundamental abstraction, modularity and encapsulation mechanisms in OOP from a software engineering and representational perspective.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Compiler Design Principles
CMSC_ELEC.description: A detailed study of the design and implementation of a compiler for a high-level programming language.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Data Visualization
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course addresses the theoretical and practical issues in creating visual representations of large amounts of data.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Graphical User Interface Programming
CMSC_ELEC.description: This is a practical, hands-on course in how to program interactive 2-D graphical user interfaces using the X11/Motif package and OpenGL.

CMSC_ELEC.title: An introduction to information and coding theory.
CMSC_ELEC.description: An introduction to information and coding theory.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Cryptology
CMSC_ELEC.description: An introduction to cryptology, the science of making and breaking codes and ciphers.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Information Assurance
CMSC_ELEC.description: Selected recent research topics in information assurance, such as social engineering, buffer overflow, malicious code, spyware, denial of service, information warfare, computer forensics, recovery and response, enterprise security, clandestine channels and emissions security, security analysis, security models and formal techniques, best practices, and national policy for information assurance.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Design Patterns
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course is an introduction to software design patterns.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Logic for Computer Science
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course covers the fundamental topics in sentential and first-order logic, including models, logical consequence, deduction and the completeness theorem.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Applied Combinatorics and Graph Theory
CMSC_ELEC.description: An introduction to the application of combinatorial methods to computer science.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Quantum Computation
CMSC_ELEC.description: The course begins with a brief overview of those topics in quantum mechanics and mathematics needed for the understanding of quantum computation.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Electronic Commerce
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course puts special emphasis on the studentâs ability to do research in existing and emerging technology and to summarize and present findings clearly.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Electronic Commerce Technology
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course is designed to prepare students to be e-commerce developers.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Natural Language Programming
CMSC_ELEC.description: The course will introduce the students to the problems, methods, and applications of Natural Language Programming (NLP).

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Neural Networks
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course is an in-depth introduction to neural networks.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Information Retrieval
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course is an introduction to the theory and implementation of software systems designed to search through large collections of text.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Agent Architectures and Multi-Agent Systems
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course covers fundamental techniques for developing intelligent agents and multi-agent systems.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
CMSC_ELEC.description: The course will introduce the students to the problems, methods, and applications of Natural Language Programming (NLP).

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Robotics
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course covers fundamental concepts, methodologies, and algorithms related to autonomous mobile robotics, touching on mechanical, motor, sensory, perceptual, and cognitive aspects of the problem of building robots that move about and decide what to do on their own.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Java Server Technologies
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course is an in-depth look at several of the technologies currently in use to develop applications for the Web.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Mobile Telephony Communications
CMSC_ELEC.description: This course provides a technical introduction to mobile radio telephony.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Introduction to Network Security
CMSC_ELEC.description: The objective of this course is to teach the fundamental concepts, architectures, and protocols related to network security.

CMSC_ELEC.title: Capstone Games Group Project
CMSC_ELEC.description: The computer games capstone course is designed to allow students completing the computer science games track to engage in a complete group project development experience.

MATH.title: Calculus and Analytic Geometry I
MATH.description: Topics of this course include limits, continuity, the rate of change, derivatives, differentiation formulas for algebraic, trigonometric, logarithmic, and exponential functions, maxima and minima, integration and computation of areas, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, areas and volumes of solids of revolution, and applications.

MATH.title: Calculus and Analytic Geometry II
MATH.description: Topics of this course include inverse functions, methods of integration, improper integrals, hyperbolic functions, sequences and infinite series, power series, Taylor series, conic sections, polar coordinates, and applications.

MATH.title: Introduction to Linear Algebra
MATH.description: Topics of this course include: linear equations, Gauss-Jordan reduction, matrices and determinants and their properties, vector spaces and subspaces, basis and dimension, linear transformations, kernel and range, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, and matrix diagonalization.

MATH.title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Scientists and Engineers
MATH.description: An introduction to applied statistics designed for science majors and others with demonstrated quantitative ability.

SCIENCE.title: Foundations of Biology: Cells, Energy and Organisms
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include structure and synthesis of nucleic acids and proteins, molecular genetics, prokaryotic and eukaryotic cell structure and function, biochemistry of energy transformation, and animal and plant development and physiology.

SCIENCE.title: Foundations of Biology: Ecology and Evolution
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Human Anatomy and Physiology I
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Human Anatomy and Physiology I Lab
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Molecular and General Genetics
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Molecular and General Genetics Lab
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Plant Biology
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Plant Biology Lab
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Comparative Animal Physiology
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Cell Biology Lab
SCIENCE.description: Major topics include fundamental concepts in ecology and evolution and emphasizes the fundamental interrelationship between these two fields of study.

SCIENCE.title: Principles of chemistry I
SCIENCE.description: An introduction to chemistry for science majors and other students who require a thorough grounding in the principles of chemistry.

SCIENCE.title: Principles of chemistry II
SCIENCE.description: Principles of chemical and physical equilibrium, liquids and solids, elementary thermodynamics, electron and proton transfer reactions, electrochemistry, chemical kinetics and a further study of the periodic properties of the elements.

SCIENCE.title: Principles of chemistry II Lab
SCIENCE.description: Principles of chemical and physical equilibrium, liquids and solids, elementary thermodynamics, electron and proton transfer reactions, electrochemistry, chemical kinetics and a further study of the periodic properties of the elements.

SCIENCE.title: Physical Geography
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.

SCIENCE.title: Principles of Geology
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.

SCIENCE.title: Environmental Science and Conservation
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.

SCIENCE.title: Introductory Physics I
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.

SCIENCE.title: Introductory Physics II
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes electricity, magnetism, heat and thermodynamics.

SCIENCE.title: Introductory Physics I Lab
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.

SCIENCE.title: Fundamentals of Astronomy and Astrophysics
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.

SCIENCE.title: Vibrations and Waves
SCIENCE.description: This course emphasizes classical mechanics.
